intro: Phlegmariurus silveirae, commonly known as the Silveira's haircap moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and dark green to brownish-green coloration. The plant has a wiry stem with leaves that are elongated and pointed, often curved at the tip. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or on rocky substrates. Phlegmariurus silveirae plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
